Package software.leonov.common.io

Interface FileWalker<R>

  • Type Parameters:
    R - the type of result returned by this FileWalker
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimpleFileWalker
    public interface FileWalker<R>
    An implementation of this interface is provided to the walkFileTree methods.

    This interface is modeled after the FileVisitor interface available in Java 7.

    Warning: The java.io.File facility provides no platform-independent way to detect symbolic links, as such there is no way to ensure a symbolic link to a directory is not followed when traversing a file tree. In the presence of symbolic links, you may encounter files outside the starting directory, or even end up in an infinite loop.

    Note: While this class is not deprecated, Java 7+ users are highly encouraged to switch to FileVisitor in the The Java NIO.2 File System introduced in JDK 7.

    Author:
    Zhenya Leonov

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static class  FileWalker.VisitResult
      The result type of a FileWalker.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      R getResult()
      Returns the result of this iteration.
      FileWalker.VisitResult postVisitDirectory​(File dir)
      This method will be called for a directory after entries in the directory, and all of their descendants, are visited.
      FileWalker.VisitResult preVisitDirectory​(File dir)
      This method will be called for a directory before entries in the directory are visited.
      FileWalker.VisitResult visitFile​(File file)
      This method will be called for each file that is encountered in a directory.
      FileWalker.VisitResult visitFileFailed​(File file, IOException ex)
      This method will be called when a file is a directory that could not be opened, and other reasons.

    • Method Detail

      • getResult

        R getResult()
        Returns the result of this iteration.

        This is an optional operation. Implementations may choose to throw an UnsupportedOperationException or return null.

        For example this method may return a list of file(s) which match a certain criteria in a directory tree, simulating the Unix/Linux find or Windows search commands.

        Returns:
        the result of this iteration

      • preVisitDirectory

        FileWalker.VisitResult preVisitDirectory​(File dir)
        This method will be called for a directory before entries in the directory are visited.
        Parameters:
        dir - the specified directory
        Returns:
        CONTINUE to visit the entries in this directory
        SKIP to skip this directory
        SKIP_SIBLINGS to skip this directory and it's siblings
        TERMINATE to terminate the traversal

      • postVisitDirectory

        FileWalker.VisitResult postVisitDirectory​(File dir)
        This method will be called for a directory after entries in the directory, and all of their descendants, are visited.
        Parameters:
        dir - the specified directory
        Returns:
        CONTINUE to continue with the next file or directory
        SKIP_SIBLINGS to skip the siblings of this directory
        TERMINATE to terminate the traversal

      • visitFile

        FileWalker.VisitResult visitFile​(File file)
                          throws IOException
        This method will be called for each file that is encountered in a directory.
        Parameters:
        file - the specified file
        Returns:
        CONTINUE to continue with the next file or directory
        SKIP_SIBLINGS to skip the siblings of this file
        TERMINATE to terminate the traversal
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • visitFileFailed

        FileWalker.VisitResult visitFileFailed​(File file,
                                       IOException ex)
                                throws IOException
        This method will be called when a file is a directory that could not be opened, and other reasons.
        Parameters:
        file - the specified file or directory
        ex - the I/O exception that prevented the file from being visited
        Returns:
        CONTINUE to continue with the next file or directory
        SKIP_SIBLINGS to skip the siblings of this file
        TERMINATE to terminate the traversal
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
